p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the application of Lee Kee for a writ of habeas corpus Petition
To the Honorable Roger S Greene sole presiding Judge of said Court
The petition of No Liv respectfully represents

I. That Lee Kee is unlawfully imprisoned confined and restrained of his liberty by James H Woolery chief of police and leeping the jail of the city of Seattle at the city jail of said City in King County Washington Territory

II. That the cause or pretense of his aforesaid confinement and restraint according to your petitioners best knowledge and belief is by virtue of an alleged committment, a copy of which is hereto annexed worded Exhibit "A" and made part hereof.
III. That your petitioner is advised and verily believes that the imprisonment of the said Lee Kee is illegal and that said illegality consists in
First That the offense charged in the said alleged commitment of itself constitutes no crime for which the said Lee Kee should be restrained of his liberty
Second That the court from which said alleged commutment issued had no jurisdiction of said pretended offense
Third That the Court from which said alleged commitment (NEW PAGE) issued had no authority to issue the same.
Fourth: That the said pretended commitment is void upon itsface
Fifth That the ordinance of the city of Seattle, for a violation of which is named in said commitment as cause therefor is without authority of law and is void.
Sixth And that by reason of for each of said causes the prisoner is deprived of his liberty without due process of law.

Wherefor your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said James H Woolery Chief of Police and Jailer of said city of Seattle commanding him to have the body of the said Lee Kee before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered before your honor together with the time and cause of the said Lee Kee's detention and said writ. and that the said Lee Kee may be restored to his liberty.
his Wo Lin On behalf of Lee Kee
Territory of Washington County of King ss.

Wo Lin being duly sworn on oath says that he is the subscriber to the alm foregoing heletion, that he the on behalf of the said Lee Kee : that he has heard read the said petition, and believes the statements and allegations to be true Wo Lin his name Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29 day of May 1885 Harold Preston Notary Public
